bg.x2d.geo

Class Paintbrush2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.geo.FreeDraw2D
      • bg.x2d.geo.Paintbrush2D

  • public class Paintbrush2D
extends FreeDraw2D
    Paintbrush provides an easy to use utility to draw figures and polygons. Calling its nextStroke method will add the specified coordinate to the object's list, and can be immediately drawn onto the canvas if the boolean passed is true.
    The width and height parameters in the constructors should be the size of the component of which you are painting on, while the Graphics parameter is the Graphics object the component uses in its paint method.
    Paintbrush will allow you to draw arbitrary, open figures, however, they are not able to be treated as objects and cannot be specifically redrawn/undrawn. It will also allow you to create a Polygon from your figure which will automatically close the first and last points with a straight line. The drawPolygon method will return the Polygon object you have created as well as draw/fill the shape on screen.

    public void exampleMethod() {
    //Create a paintbrush object, assuming the two integer values and the Graphics object have been defined elsewhere in the class.
    Paintbrush brush = new Paintbrush(width,height,graphics);
    //If you were to set these boolean arguments to true, the line would be immediately painted onto the canvas.
    brush.nextStroke(20,20,false);
    brush.nextStroke(30,40,false);
    brush.nextStroke(40,20,false);
    //We have added all of our coordinates (similar to how the Polygon object works) so now we can draw it.
    brush.drawPolygon(true);
    }

    An example of drawing an arbitrary figure with Paintbrush:

    public void exampleTwo() {
    //Create the paintbrush object, assuming all variables are defined elsewhere.
    Paintbrush brush = new Paintbrush(width,height,graphics);
    brush.nextStroke(30,42,true);
    //Note that this stroke won't show up after this method is called since the boolean passed is false.
    brush.nextStroke(40,20,false);
    brush.nextStroke(56,104,false);
    //This method will take all of the coordinates you have given it and draw the connected lines onto the canvas.
    brush.drawStrokes();
    //This clears the coordinate data so a new figure can be drawn.
    brush.clear();
    }

    Since:
    2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
    See Also:
    Polygon

    • Method Detail

      • nextStroke

        public void nextStroke(int x,
              int y,
              boolean draw,
              Graphics canvas)
        Adds the passed coordinate to the Paintbrush's list and optionally draws it onto the canvas.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the point
        y - the y coordinate of the point
        draw - if true, the line will be drawn onto the canvas immediately.
        See Also:
        #drawStrokes()

      • setPoints

        public void setPoints(int[] xpoints,
             int[] ypoints)
               throws GeoException
        Clears the currently stored coordinates list and sets it to the passed x and y point arrays. Each position will correspond to its equivalent in the opposite array. i.e. (xpoints[0],ypoints[0]) is a point.
        Parameters:
        xpoints - An array of x points corresponding to an array of y points.
        ypoints - An array of y points corresponding to an array of x points.
        Throws:
        GeoException

      • drawStrokes

        public void drawStrokes(Graphics canvas)
        Draws all currently set lines to the canvas.
        See Also:
        #drawPolygon(boolean fill)

      • drawPolygon

        public Polygon drawPolygon(Graphics canvas,
                  boolean fill)
                    throws GeoException
        Draws a polygon using the currently set coordinates to the canvas.
        Parameters:
        fill - determines whether or not to fill the drawn polygon, or just draw an outline.
        Returns:
        the constructed Polygon object.
        Throws:
        GeoException
        See Also:
        Polygon

      • deleteLast

        public void deleteLast()
        Removes the last set point from the coordinate list. This will NOT undraw anything from the canvas.

      • lastStroke

        public int[] lastStroke()
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the last stroke made.

      • getStrokeAt

        public int[] getStrokeAt(int index)
                  throws GeoException
        Retrieves the specified stroke if existent.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        an int array representing a x and y coordinate.
        Throws:
        GeoException - if argument is less than zero or greater than the current array capacity.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this Paintbrush object's coordinate/stroke data. Does nothing to the screen.
        See Also:
        isCleared()

      • isCleared

        public boolean isCleared()
        Returns:
        true if the internal coordinate ArrayList is empty. false otherwise.
